website_summaries.verdict: An updated version of this parenting classic that sheds light on the father-to-be’s experience in pregnancy and childbirth.
pros: Comprehensive and serious in tone but engaging enough for non-readers
Helps dads-to-be understand what to expect in the mother’s and child’s development
And also what he might be going through emotionally, and other under-addressed topics
Addresses a diversity of impending fatherhood situations (like IVF, adoption, active-duty fatherhood, etc
cons: Some reviewers view as a bit condescending towards men and authors’ opinions offensive on certain topics

customer_reviews.title: 1st 100 pages are great --- dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this book 4x times now. Each time i get to roughly page 100 my Bernese mountain dog puppy eats it.... Wherever they are storing this book in the warehouse -- must be next to the dog treats. There are over 200 books in my house in various locations -- but the dog only eats (and to date has only eaten) this book.... I think ill just get the audiobook this time. In all seriousness - very balanced and informative book. Highly recommend....hoping to be able to finish it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Welsch

customer_reviews.title: Would use as a fire-starter.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. We both HATED the patriarchal, didactic tone. I’d have returned it, but it wasn’t worth the effort. We won’t be recommending or sharing this with newly-pregnant friends.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: “Holier than thou” tone towards IVF and AI
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I was looking forward to this book. Then I read he first three chapters and was disgusted by the author’s condescending tone toward IVF and AI. My wife and I tried for 3 years, eventually had to resort to IVF, and have a beautiful baby on the way. The book felt like a slap to the face. If you and your partner used either IVF or any sort of AI, so your self a favor and avoid this book.
customer_reviews.author: K.E. Davila

customer_reviews.title: Really good book for first time fathers like myself
customer_reviews.text: Really good book for first time fathers like myself. Goes month to month on what to expect and describes how you, baby, and your partner may be feeling. Iam not a huge reader but this kept me entertained and interested at times I couldn't put the book down. There are some chapters that were less interesting but I think that all depends on the individual. Overall great book!
customer_reviews.author: BILLMGOBLUE

customer_reviews.title: Good choice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as the way to surprise my husband that I was pregnant. I almost bought one of the more gag gift "dude bro" type books, but I'm so glad I didn't! My husband, who is not a book reader, is actually reading this thing and taking it seriously. So it's a good thing I bought a book with actual useful information in it. As for contents, it talks about what the expecting mother is going through, how he should help, and how to deal with things he might going through.
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Great Read for New Dads!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this book! He's reading it month by month as we progress through our pregnancy and he loves sharing the knowledge he's learning. It's got recipes he can cook for me and helps him better understand what I'm going through (like, perfectly!). Excellent resource for new dads!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Henry

customer_reviews.title: Finally a book for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a book (and series) that blends helpful information and humor and presents it from the father's perspective. I have found it both readable and useful providing details about not only how my child is developing but what my wife might be experiencing and tips for supporting our relationship while we raise our child. He also takes time to acknowledge the unique feelings and thoughts of men as parents. Very refreshing and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Decent, with some shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: Having heard so much about this book on the usual blogs/reddit/etc, I was somewhat underwhelmed when I went through it. It has some useful information in it, but it has a tendency to almost condescendingly depict us dads-to-be as "lovable but bumbling morons" who can't figure out even the most basic tasks on our own. All in all not a bad read, but there are better options out there for anyone pressed for time.
customer_reviews.author: Seventh-777Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great book, but don't rely on this for info about circumcision
customer_reviews.text: Great book with minimal references to men being lazy dude-bros or clueless laundry detergent commercial dads. The only thing about this book is that the author very clearly has an agenda when it comes to circumcision, at times misrepresenting the scientific information regarding it. He also presents "for" and "against" sections for circumcision, but one of these sections is written in such a way that it agrees with the other side of the argument (kind of like a back-handed compliment).
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this book to me while my wife was pregnant with our first child. I thought the information was okay at best. I didn’t like the author’s stance on birth plans. (Make one if you want, just don’t show it to anyone, especially not your doctor). My wife and I made a birth plan and yes, we showed it to our doctor. She was supportive in every way and open and receptive to our wishes. Most of the information is common sense, and I stopped reading about 3/4 of the way through my wife’s pregnancy. It just wasn’t adding any value to our situation, or so I felt.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Miller

customer_reviews.title: Some good except the parts regarding pregnancy written by a man...
customer_reviews.text: This book is well meaning but I should have read it before giving it to my husband and tore out a couple pages like the one that said he’s pregnant too. It focuses more on the stereotypical “dad” responsibilities like budgeting, leading the household etc (which doesn’t match our household format). It also went on a rant about how it’s hard for dads to be stay at home dads in our society, while I’m sure that has some truth I was looking to get my husband a cliff notes version of what to expect so he could support my pregnancy, understand what’s going on along the way and this book fell a little short of that.
customer_reviews.author: katy petzak

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my husband so that I could get him more involved and informed in TTC. I haven't read the book in full, but he's read me passages. I believe a good amount of the information in it is accurate and helpful, but I also believe that so much of it is outdated and takes a sexist approach to fatherhood.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Must read for all expectant dads
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely written from a specific point of view of the writers which seems to make it more personal and I felt easier to read. It covers the subjects in depth and adds personal experiences to make ti more relatable. It covers a WIDE range of topics and really in retrospect I think it answered 95% of the questions I had and 100% of the things I have no thought to ask. I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Michael

customer_reviews.title: Skewed opinions on pregnant women and their experiences
customer_reviews.text: I got this book for my husband to read while i read my pregnancy books at night. I started reading the first few chapters and was mortified at some of the "descriptions" of what someones pregnant partner could be going through. Such as "coming into the second trimester, your partner could be having resentment and jealousy towards you now that the pregnancy is not solely theirs and they now have to share it with you". Excuse me? I would say if youre going to write a book on pregnancy, just because your wife was a loon, doesn't mean that all women are not thrilled to experience pregnancy with their partner... Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: What a great book! This book covers so many different aspects ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great book! This book covers so many different aspects of the entire birthing process. It helps fathers-to-be have a better grasp on the physical and emotional changes taking place throughout each stage of the pregnancy. More importantly, it helps dads normalize their fears of parenting and gives amazing advice on how they can be supportive and encouraging to their partners. I did a lot of research before settling on this book and I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is unique, but this guide has had more right than wrong so far.
customer_reviews.text: It's enjoyable to read. I appreciate the author including other types of "becoming a father" like adoption, and they clearly mark these sections so you don't need to read what doesn't apply to you. The humor is a bit dry, but you will laugh when it hits on something you've also experienced. "Salad Months" was not only the most aptly named chapter, but well timed in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first time dad
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought this book for my husband after we announced we were pregnant with our first child. My husband has really enjoyed the expecting book as it has helped him to better understand all the steps of my pregnancy that wouldn’t make sense for someone not going through it! He enjoys that it has research to back it up and is from a mans perspective who in no way tries to pretend he knows what a woman goes through to have a baby, just how to be understanding and supportive. So I appreciate it too!
customer_reviews.author: Megan P.

customer_reviews.title: To sum up the book: You'll have feelings and that is normal.
customer_reviews.text: As the author might review something, "Reading this book, you may learn a little or a lot. Some of you may even learn nothing, and that is normal and okay." For me, listing the entire range of feelings and expectations did little to benefit me as I am already aware that I will feel something on that spectrum. I am still giving four stars, because I know that all readers will be different and maybe some people need to hear that whatever they experience is okay. My personal advice is to just talk to other Fathers about all stages and take whatever comes in stride as there are no fix-all solutions to everything as the book states.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to read, lots of information
customer_reviews.text: This book has a nice approach to the stage when you are expecting a baby from the father's perspective. Most of the material out there is for moms so its refreshing to have a male perspective guiding you through some of the most typical questions. It's packed with a lot of information, most of it is common sense but it's nice to have a reference and reassurance that what you are going through is normal. Having the information from the book was a great topic of conversation with my wife during the pregnancy as she was reading different books we would compare the advice from different sources and found what seemed most reasonable for us.
customer_reviews.author: CaffeineOwnsMe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent information!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son for Father's Day. He and his wife are expecting their first child in 5 months, and he reports that this book is packed with good information, presented in a way that is easily understood. Of real importance, it addresses issues that had never occurred to either of them. There are hundreds of books for expectant mothers, but the father's questions and information from his perspective are not that available. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Formatting is weird but info is good
customer_reviews.text: This book is very informative and great at tackling topics from many sides of pregnancy, I would recommend it for anyone growing a family. The formatting is a little weird though, there will be a box in the middle of a paragraph that has extra info but that box will take up two pages and the paragraph will be cut off for two pages, causing you to have to skip ahead to finish a sentence and then go back if you want to read the box.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to have a book of this sort that doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have a book of this sort that doesn't include the words "Dude" or "Bro" in the title. However, I'm not sure how much reading this is going to help me. Be nice to your partner. Check. Save your money. Check. I think I knew that much already. Also, the part of the book that gives instructions on how to deliver the baby yourself is completely ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire Tinted

customer_reviews.title: Stay away unless you have a hard on for the Marines.
customer_reviews.text: This book sucks unless you're a deadbeat dad that didn't want your kid in the first place...at least from what I've read. Also, you probably need to love the marines, because this guy keeps on flashing back to his 3-year your he did in the Peace-time Marines as a cook, which is pretty ridiculous and a waste of time. I learned nothing from this book. If you don't have common sense, it might help in a few spots, but I'd still recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Haven't read it myself... My husband is ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't read it myself... My husband is currently reading it... Apparently it gets a little odd at some points recommending 2 glasses of wine daily, doulas/spiritual/home births mostly, etc.... But it does have my husband cooking regularly, keeping the fridge stocked, letting me nap, and since reading it he has only told me "maybe it is all in your head" once (the doctor's appointment the next day confirmed that it in fact was not all in my head)...
customer_reviews.author: lucky_pez

customer_reviews.title: This have a great summary of what he should expect and I think ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband was nervous about the arrival of our baby (our first) and the baby book that I had was more centered around the changes that I should expect during pregnancy. This have a great summary of what he should expect and I think have him some confidence with the knowledge that he gained. He isn't really an avid reader and enjoyed this book a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gibeault

customer_reviews.title: Wish  I could give it 0
customer_reviews.text: This book did nothing to help make me feel prepared, if anything it made me feel worse. It left opened ended statements, never explained anything and mostly told me what shes going through, which I already got from her book and talking with her. Dont get this
customer_reviews.author: Corey McCready

customer_reviews.title: 100% Should be compulsory for first time dads.
customer_reviews.text: It will forever be my only recommendation I will ever make to a fellow future survivor. Rather than spitting out pregnancy facts that you can only find everywhere, in lists; the book really takes the opportunity to talk to the man and prepare you for some of what you are going to go through and experience, in addition to her. Bit of a prep to be a dad, bit of prep to be a man, but its good prep. If you take nothing else from the book, take: You do not need to be right or win. U need to be understanding.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Best Expecting-Father Book So Far
customer_reviews.text: We've gotten three books for expectant fathers, and this is definitely the winner. It's remarkably engaging, deeply empathetic, and packed full of useful facts, perspectives, and ideas. The dad in our soon-to-be-family said, "When I read 40 pages in a book in the first sitting without looking up, I know it's good."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good book if you actually want to know how to ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is just about worrying. Not a good book if you actually want to know how to prepare and what to know. More like if you really love worrying and not having any knowledge about what is and isn’t a real concern.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT COOPER YOUNG

customer_reviews.title: A bit dry...
customer_reviews.text: I got this book in hopes that it would be fun and interesting to read, but honestly it is a dry read. There is a lack of humor in it, and it is all too serious. I have read other books for Dads to be that make it a fun and exciting read whereas this book is very nuts and bolts and goes into subjects at length and can be tough to really enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: As a soon to be first time father my wife bought this for me, it’s very informative but for some who may know a little more than normal it may seem basic. Still would recommend for a first time soon to be father.
customer_reviews.author: PoussoNR

customer_reviews.title: Easy read and really useful information
customer_reviews.text: A great book for an expecting father! Read this while my wife was pregnant and it was a wonderful resource. She was very well read and knowledgeable of everything going on, but I sometimes would read something in here that even she wasn't aware of. Kept me in the loop and feeling involved. It's brief and hits all the major points. It's also a great gift for a friend when they are expecting for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus E Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time dads.
customer_reviews.text: This book made the roller coaster ride of being a first time dad-to-be manageable. I was able to better understand what my wife was going through and the problems she was dealing with and what I could do to help. The book is not just a list of scientific studies and biological facts but also subjective personal beliefs sprinkled in which you can choose to follow or ignore. Overall, it make the process less scary and unpredictable and that is all you can ask for when you are a father in training. I absolutely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: JPick

customer_reviews.title: Great book for dads, very informative
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great book. There was a lot of information on nuts and bolts type stuff from recipes to 529’s but a lot of discussion about emotional stuff and how and where to be involved. Some of it seemed to basically tell dads-to-be you have to be involved and be nice to your wife so that’s where some of the “it’s condescending” reviews came from but ultimately it is informative and good.
customer_reviews.author: Richie and Guerla

customer_reviews.title: Some useful info but outdated tone and stereotypes
customer_reviews.text: Some helpful basic information in places, but the patriarchal tone felt out of touch with modern parenthood. Oddly there’s a section at the end of the book criticising stereotypical portrayal of fathers in media aimed at children, having spent most of the book having reinforcing some of these stereotypes. I also didn’t like that the only recommendations for further reading were just his other books in this series. Sadly won’t be recommending to other expectant fathers.
customer_reviews.author: John Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect & Practical for any New Dad-to-Be
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my already-awesome husband as we wait for our firstborn. He has mentioned he enjoyed it, likes how it is written and that a lot of the info is really helpful and great for following along and being involved during the expecting journey, with good and practical reminders. I would gift this to any dad-to-be.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Nicely covers every aspect of the pregnancy including the effect ...
customer_reviews.text: gift for a father to be .They ALL need all the help they can get!! Nicely covers every aspect of the pregnancy including the effect on " future Dad". and his role during the pregnancy. Filled with realistic expectations ,advice and support to help fathers cope with and survive the nine months wait!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia W. Marcum

customer_reviews.title: This is the most useful pregnancy book I have read
customer_reviews.text: This is the most useful pregnancy book I have read. It's definitely not just for fathers. I found it a lot more informative than my books for mothers.
customer_reviews.author: 8alana8

customer_reviews.title: First-time parent must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to read during my pregnancy and he's really enjoyed it. He is reading along month by month as I progress in pregnancy and it's allowed him to feel somewhat involved and aware of what is happening to my body, hormones, etc. I was recently worried about a pain I experienced and he grabbed the book to show me that he'd just read it was completely normal. Definitely recommend for first-time parents!
customer_reviews.author: JayAR

customer_reviews.title: He liked it so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my husband over a year ago when were started talking about trying. He got the audio book and finished in within the first week during his work commute. He liked it so much, he gave it to me for me to listen to as well. There is a lot of information in this book not just for the expectant father but useful for the expectant mother as well. Useful information like finances regarding tests, planning, the birth, staying at the hospital, recovery, etc. After both listening to the audio book, we felt ready and much more educated than even our friends that had already had babies. I would highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: So much useful Info
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are expecting our first baby together (we have two much older children already). i love the layout of this book and the useful information. example: it talks about dealing with insurance and bills from the hospital, to comb through them yourself as hospital billing is often very wrong. neither my husband or myself had ever heard this before and will now do it for ever medial bill. also i wish the authors made an equivalent book for mom, if it was laid out the same with all the useful info. id love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book! Great for your first baby I got both my husband and I a baby book and his book was so much better then mine, his was funny and very informative. I gave up on my book and had my husband read his book to me so A. Our baby got us to his voice and B. It was so soothing to listen to him read to me lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great resource for first time dads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He loves it! It's written particularly with him in mind, and is helping him to work though his emotions regarding our pregnancy. He has found that many of his worries are more common than he thought, and can better explain them to me after finding that others feel the same way. The book also helps explain things that are going on with me and the baby so he can feel in the know and included!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good read
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby as we are having our first baby. He gives it 4 out of 5. He would prefer the list be better assembled and a calendar with a full timeline. However he enjoys reading along as each month changes and likes to read ahead so he knows what to except in the following month. I have enjoyed him learning from this book. It has been helpful for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Good book my wife decide I need to read before our baby arrived. A lot of good information I wished I would have started reading when she first got pregnant
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J Selvig

customer_reviews.title: Fabulously entertaining, but still practical
customer_reviews.text: A fabulously entertaining, but still practical, guide for fathers-to-be. A month by month guide to what's going on with: a) your unborn child, b) your lady, c) you! Easy to read, and well worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Razorstorm

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The first book I've read on the subject after finding out last month that we're pregnant. Great, useful info and highly recommended (I could just do with a little less of the self-promotion...the author seems to plug his other books on every other page.)
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: A perfect gift for expecting fathers
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this thoughtful, well-written, and occasionally humorous book. It is incredibly informative for expectant father’s (& mothers honestly) and the advice is practical, with clear examples that are sure to help anyone who desires to be a true partner in pregnancy. Would make a perfect gift for expectant fathers!
customer_reviews.author: Ainsley L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dad Book
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book. It really is a man talking to a man. It wasn’t too much info or overload for him.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kesler

customer_reviews.title: Love this book so much, it helped me a lot and I've bought it for many others
customer_reviews.text: I have two children and I can not say how invaluable this book was during my wife's pregnancy. I absolutely love it and I've bought it for any of my guy friends who's significant other is expecting. Highly recommend to anyone who has a baby on the way to better understand what's going on in your world and hers. Buy. It. Now.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for new dads
customer_reviews.text: Overall, informative read. However, some chapters are out of place, almost like the author had to fill the pages (example, talking about college savings for most of month 4 or 5 chapter - not exactly what’s on my mind at that point). Still enjoyed the format and presentation of the information.
customer_reviews.author: TechDad1331

customer_reviews.title: A must for a new dad
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for our first pregnancy. He is empathetic and understanding but this book really helps him feel more connected with what I’m going through. The plaid cover is cute. It goes over all the same stuff as the “what to expect when you’re expecting” book but in “guy talk”.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Mead

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this book
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually post Amazon reviews, but I felt like I needed to in this case. My wife was suckered in by the overwhelmingly positive reviews on this book, but it is truly a load of dated, patriarchal crap. I read probably 40% of it before I had to put it down. We're having our first kid and all I wanted was a decent, up-to-date book about being a dad; this is not that book.
customer_reviews.author: John Hest

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness!
customer_reviews.text: Fhis book is amazing! It went month by month, walking my first time parent husband through what to expect. It not only prepared him for the changing moods, cravings, and physical aspects of pregnancy, but explained WHY these things were happening. It gave him understanding and reassurance things would get better, and helped him be the most supportive fater-to-be!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC reference book; A bit overwhelming
customer_reviews.text: This book is a FANTASTIC reference book. It is definitely meant to be taken in small doses though. The author(s?) did a lot of research about everything, even into things they didn't experience themselves and they cover almost anything that can happen during pregnancy. It's incredibly informative and educational (without being too opinionated), but it can definitely be overwhelming if you're looking for something a little more like an overview. My husband loves this book and has raved about it our entire pregnancy. Would DEFINITELY recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Ericksen

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves this book!!
customer_reviews.text: we're having our first baby and my husband loves this book! it's nice how it is sectioned out by months of pregnancy! gives him something to read from time to time! after reading not so great reviews about "dude, you're gonna be a dad!" I decided to go with this book for it's more logical information. so glad we did!! great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Informative, easy read
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband when we found out we were expecting. He's actually been very faithful about reading it and says it's been really helpful for him. Good information on the ins-and-outs of pregnancy, and since it's told from a male perspective, he can relate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my husband after finding out we were pregnant. He's been able to follow along each stage of the pregnancy and enjoys telling me the "facts" he's learned. He likes that the book is written for men, unlike so many pregnancy books. And I like that he's very involved with the information and up to date on what I/we are going through! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A.

customer_reviews.title: I bought it as a Father's Day gift for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a Father's Day gift for my son who is about to become a first time father in a few weeks. He has read it and highly recommends it. I have also purchased the second book in the series and will be giving it to him when the baby arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Retarded
customer_reviews.text: Uhhh you open to a random page in the book to start checking it out and literally talks about having an affair during pregnancy when a man feels excluded and how it’s okay. It’s such a biased book too. What kind of book talks about a woman licking an ash tray or eating clay... LOL. It’s good for a gag
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my husband as we are pregnant with our first. Very well written and easy to follow. He isn't much of a reader, but quite enjoys reading this book and that it explains how both mother and father may feel. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Zalee Davis

customer_reviews.title: A Book for Dads not Dudes
customer_reviews.text: Having attempted to read various books for father's to be I was starting to get discouraged. They all seemed so trivial, at best. I suppose if you really are a "dude" then those books might work, but if you have the EQ and intelligence greater than a high schooler you might want something more. This is that something more. It is a book that doesn't completely skip the obvious (we are guys, after all), but it doesn't just stay in that shallow water. It goes beyond the typical dos and dont's and explains how to truly be a part of the pregnancy and birth. I would highly recommend this to any father to be.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: My husband loved this book
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book. It reads easy, we would typically read it together each new month of pregnancy to compare if the writer "actually" knew what he was talking about as far as how the woman is feeling...he was pretty spot on! Has great tips and information for first time parents!! Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Informative and clear
customer_reviews.text: This book is well written and informative. I liked the tone better than several other books I picked up. Down to earth, but not calling me dude or bro, because I am a grown man preparing for a child, not getting psyched up to chug some beers. The inclusion of statistics and studies helps broaden my knowledge with facts. I would get this book for any expecting father.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time dads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after we found out we were expecting our first child. He reads 1 month ahead of where I am at in my pregnancy. He seems to find it interesting and will regularly read me tidbits he thinks I might enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good Information
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as we are expecting our first child together, he really enjoys all of the advice and it's helped him understand a lot about what he's going through and what I'm going through. Thank you for writing this book!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great book for first time dad’s
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been reading this book and sharing all types of good information. I wish they had a women’s version because it sounds so much more interesting than any of the books I have. He consistently reads it so it must capture his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Only book you need
customer_reviews.text: I read about 5 different books leading up to the birth of my first born. This was by far the best one. I have purchased this book as a gift for my friends becoming new fathers. I am not a big reader and this book allows you to read one chapter per month as the pregnancy is going on. Also, some sections are specific to certain people (ex: military). You may not need to read every section. Overall, very educating and an easy read!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Melnick

customer_reviews.title: Great book. I am in the military and am ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book. I am in the military and am currently stationed in a different state than my wife. Its great being informed with what is going on and the author is easily relate-able. The book has even helped me to understand some of the feelings/frustrations that I have been going through as part of the pregnancy (most of which are petty and stupid, but nice to know that I am not alone).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved having a book for my boyfriend to read while ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved having a book for my boyfriend to read while going through pregnancy. He loved knowing what I was going through and was very supportive
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dads!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book! I presented it to him as a gift when I found out I was pregnant. When I didn't get the chance to read my "what to expect" book he would fill me in and surprisingly the book was really on point and in tune with what was going on. It was very thorough and detailed and it allowed him to be a better support to me throughout the pregnancy. He still uses it as a reference from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Supreme Skin & Body

customer_reviews.title: Good for my hubby
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he really seems to like it. My husband isn’t a very emotional guy - I think that this book makes him more understanding about what is going on with me - he will often comment about what he read or learned. It’s very sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Husband hated this book!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as it was labeled a "best seller." Should've read these 1 star reviews first because he HATED IT. I think we only read about 1 chapters worth perusing the book. He said it was awful and pointless. He said it wasn't really factual and didn't like the author's opinions and blabbering. I wish I would've returned this book when it was within the time frame, but my husband took a long time to even pick it up. I would suggest The Birth Partner instead. He actually enjoys reading from that book.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid At Heart

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide for new Dads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son in law when my daughter was pregnant with their first child. He read if cover to cover and said he got a lot of really useful tips and suggestions from it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cherewatenko

customer_reviews.title: Son in law said this book was helpful
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son in law, he said it was helpful, was glad that he brought it with him on a business trip and had a 5 hour layover 😄😍
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: He's reading it!
customer_reviews.text: He enjoys the fact that you can flip to the months you are in and that there are relateable stories. It is chunked into pieces which allow for short reads instead of the need for an ongoing bookmark. He does not read much ever but this has been a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Wishful Tangents

customer_reviews.title: Gave as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t read the book completely since it was a gift but I did skim through it and found it informative and interesting since it’s from a dads point of view.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: This was ok. At first my husband liked it, but then he started noticing information presented as “facts” that had no factual basis, and seemed to be the author’s opinion (some of which was a bit odd). For the most part, it was informative and fact based, but the other stuff was just weird.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book! Very informative and goes month by month so he knew what to expect from our doctor appointments and what was going on with me and our little one.
customer_reviews.author: Crtnix

customer_reviews.title: and I appreciate that the book is thorough and easily explains a woman's thoughts/feelings/body changes throughout the pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves reading this book, written from a mans perspective, and I appreciate that the book is thorough and easily explains a woman's thoughts/feelings/body changes throughout the pregnancy. This allows Dad to get a full picture of what is going on and feel like he is a part of the pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Souder

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it and helped him understand a little bit more about what women go through during these times. I found this book at Barnes and Noble. So finding it on amazon for a way CHEAPER price is amazing.! I recommend it to all the "Father's To Be".
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: THIS BOOK IS AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time dad and this book does a great job of walking a line between funny and clinical. It is refreshing to find a book that gives all three perspectives (mine, hers, and the baby's). I find myself consistently surprised at how right on this book proves to be.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Huckendubler

customer_reviews.title: Great for a new father
customer_reviews.text: This was a great read. Cool to read a chapter each month while my wife progressed in her pregnancy. It was so good that I showed my wife a few chapters and she ended up reading most of this book as well. I highly Reccomened this for any new father.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!  Highly recommend for all new fathers
customer_reviews.text: The book breaks down each chapter by months, which I found to be helpful. I often found myself going back to various chapters that I needed. Also, I found the reference page at the end very helpful as we found some great resources through it!
customer_reviews.author: Arpit

customer_reviews.title: Good read, puts in a lot more extra information ...
customer_reviews.text: Good read, puts in a lot more extra information than a person probably requires, but covers a lot of aspects. Already bought the book after this by Brott, maybe that one will prepare me more for when the baby is actually here.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Not just for dads!
customer_reviews.text: So much good information in this book! As a first time mom-to-be, I found a lot of helpful information from a different perspective that really worked for me. Definitely look into this book for moms too, it's a great read!
customer_reviews.author: k_han

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and informative!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this book, while small, seems to have more facts and Information in it than my 3 books I bought for myself. My husband has read me several interesting things from this book that mine didn’t have. I have read a page or two, and I think it’s a really good read that focuses on New dads-to-be! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Dads!
customer_reviews.text: My husband read this when I was pregnant with our son and it was basically his parenthood Bible. He learned a TON through reading this book and thoroughly enjoyed it. We’ve bought it a couple times now for friends. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time dads
customer_reviews.text: Great guide for first time fathers. I purchased this for my son in law and it really helped guide his questions for the doctor during prenatal visit. It also helped him with what to prepare for and how to assist my daughter out with her pregnancy, i.e.: mood shifts, her dietary needs, and what to expect during doctor visits.
customer_reviews.author: Hattie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for expecting dads
customer_reviews.text: Dads need advice too! Great book my son hasn’t put it down yet! Lots of interesting information for dad’s to be!
customer_reviews.author: Torijo

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I feel like alot of this is to common sense. Really not big into books of this type. I think you coud get the same info from YouTube in a shorter time. The money section was useful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Reed

customer_reviews.title: Worth a read for the first timer’s
customer_reviews.text: Well, I would say for first time dad’s like me, it’s was worth it. I like the way each chapter is written by month and not weeks, because googling it and counting in weeks was really making me impatient. Also there are some good advice given in the book which is worth considering. And some good suggestions to keep your wife happy ☺️. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ravneet Chhabra

customer_reviews.title: He seemed to like it for the 10 minutes he thumbed threw it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son. He seemed to like it for the 10 minutes he thumbed threw it. He showed it to the expecting mother. She stole it and started reading. I honestly have no idea if she has given it back to him yet but she was enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Husband hated this book.
customer_reviews.text: Husband hated this book. We were looking for a competent book from a father's perspective about pregnancy and birth and this was not it for my husband. He did not appreciate the tone of the author or approach to the topics.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Tisdale

customer_reviews.title: Useless and quite disconcerting advice
customer_reviews.text: Useless and quite disconcerting advice, contradicting a lot of the Mayo Clinic’s and Obstetrician’s pregnancy recommendations. The only thing that book was good for... calming hubby’s nerves - Therefore 2 stars instead of the 1 it deserves
customer_reviews.author: nanomic

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomnded
customer_reviews.text: This book is awesome. Everything from C-sections, questions for your provider, Post Partem Depression, finances, FMLA, and more. Not only will you gain a ton of information from this but your spouse will love you even more for ordering it and "going through the pregnancy" with her. The book follows a mother through her pregnancy by month and then has several chapters dedicated to "other issues". I would recommend reading as your wife progresses in her pregnancy and read a month ahead. You can read the other issues in between.
customer_reviews.author: S. S

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable great information
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband who really enjoys reading (me not so much) and he’s enjoyed it and I’ve even had to read a few of them very interesting and enjoyable
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good book for guys
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband; we are expecting our first child. He has found the book to be hepful and informative, and I have found him to be much more understanding as I continue my pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: DSil

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Very mixed feelings about this book. Usually it is very illuminating and comprehensive. But some of the time it gets very preachy and can wander down rabbit holes. I often felt a good editor could make his book 10-20% shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Z.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Nice to have a father's perspective on ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Nice to have a father's perspective on our first child. My wife and I spent lots of time discussing our experiences and this book really helped facilitate my experience and our collectively similar and varied emotions. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer
